title: What should be the best baby gifts on a baby shower? - Quora

response.answer_text: It depends on if the baby is born when the baby shower is held and if the parents had a baby registry. When baby is still in the womb, I like to err on the side of caution. I don’t give diapers, lotions, formulas, etc. because, as is the case with my son, certain brands may cause baby to have a rash. I wouldn’t want to be responsible for someone else’s baby being in discomfort, nor do I want the parents to have to throw out my gift because they can’t use it. It is better to let the parents decide what works for them, not be forced to use something because it was a gift. Things like gift cards are a safe bet as the new parents will be able to get what they want/need. I also like to give books. It’s never to early to foster a love of learning. If there is a baby registry, I would go off of that. It might not seem very thoughtful, but the new parents will appreciate that they are able to get exactly what they want/need. If the baby is outside the womb by the time the baby shower is going on, I would find out exactly what the new couple need. Maybe they like a certain brand of diapers. Maybe they formula feed and use a certain brand. Maybe they have a zillion newborn outfits and need something for an older baby. Maybe they are swimming in receiving blankets and would like a cute toy. Maybe a bottle warmer would make their lives easier. Maybe an activity mat for their kid. Really, it could be anything, but I want to ensure I get something that the new parents want. I would also consider a personalized gift if I know the couple well. Something like a stuffy with the baby’s name, date of birth, and birth details on it or a personalized growth chart.
